Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant's application was terminated by operation of section 87.4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 87.4
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant's file reviewed in 2010 by Program Assistant; 68 points calculated; no final decision by authorized officer before March 29, 2012
Legal_Rule: Section 87.4 terminates applications for permanent residency as Federal Skilled Workers if an officer did not determine by March 29, 2012, that the applicant meets selection criteria
Procedural_Issue: Termination of application due to failure to meet statutory deadline
Key_Evidence_Considered: File review in 2010, point calculation, lack of final decision by authorized officer before deadline
Applicant_Challenge: Judicial review challenging termination under section 87.4
Legal_Rule_Source: Section 87.4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Remedy_Sought: Mandamus to compel processing of application
Claimant_Status: Applicant for permanent residency under Federal Skilled Worker category
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 87.4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet selection criteria determination by deadline
